content:
PoolSpecification PoolSpecification Class

Definition

Namespace:
Microsoft.Azure.Batch
Assembly:
Azure.Batch.dll

The specification for a pool.

Edit

In this Article

public class PoolSpecification : ITransportObjectProvider<PoolSpecification>, IPropertyMetadata, IModifiable, IReadOnlyPublic Class PoolSpecification
    Implements ITransportObjectProvider(Of PoolSpecification), IPropertyMetadata, IModifiable, IReadOnly
Inheritance
ObjectObject
PoolSpecificationPoolSpecification

Inherited Members

System.Object

ToString()ToString()
Equals(Object)Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)Equals(Object, Object)

Constructors

PoolSpecification() PoolSpecification()

Edit

Initializes a new instance of the PoolSpecification class.

public PoolSpecification()Public Sub New

Properties

ApplicationPackageReferences ApplicationPackageReferences

Edit

Gets or sets a list of application package references to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

public IList<ApplicationPackageReference> ApplicationPackageReferences { get; set; }Public Property ApplicationPackageReferences As IList(Of ApplicationPackageReference)
Value
IList<ApplicationPackageReference> IList(Of ApplicationPackageReference)

AutoScaleEnabled AutoScaleEnabled

Edit

Gets or sets whether the pool size should automatically adjust over time.

public bool ? AutoScaleEnabled { get; set; }Public Property AutoScaleEnabled As Boolean?
Value
Nullable<Boolean> Nullable(Of Boolean)

Remarks

If false, the TargetDedicated property is required.

If true, the AutoScaleFormula property is required. The pool automatically resizes according to the formula.

The default value is false.

AutoScaleEvaluationInterval AutoScaleEvaluationInterval

Edit

Gets or sets a time interval at which to automatically adjust the pool size according to the AutoScaleFormula.

public TimeSpan? AutoScaleEvaluationInterval { get; set; }Public Property AutoScaleEvaluationInterval As TimeSpan?
Value
Nullable<TimeSpan> Nullable(Of TimeSpan)

Remarks

The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum allowed value is 5 minutes.

AutoScaleFormula AutoScaleFormula

Edit

Gets or sets a formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

public string AutoScaleFormula { get; set; }Public Property AutoScaleFormula As String
Value
String String

Remarks

For how to write autoscale formulas, see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/batch-automatic-scaling/. This property is required if AutoScaleEnabled is set to true. It must be null if AutoScaleEnabled is false.

The formula is checked for validity before the pool is created. If the formula is not valid, an exception is thrown when you try to commit the PoolSpecification.

CertificateReferences CertificateReferences

Edit

Gets or sets a list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

public IList<CertificateReference> CertificateReferences { get; set; }Public Property CertificateReferences As IList(Of CertificateReference)
Value
IList<CertificateReference> IList(Of CertificateReference)

CloudServiceConfiguration CloudServiceConfiguration

Edit

Gets or sets the CloudServiceConfiguration for the pool.

public CloudServiceConfiguration CloudServiceConfiguration { get; set; }Public Property CloudServiceConfiguration As CloudServiceConfiguration
Value
CloudServiceConfiguration CloudServiceConfiguration

Remarks

This property is mutually exclusive with VirtualMachineConfiguration.

DisplayName DisplayName

Edit

Gets or sets the display name for the pool.

public string DisplayName { get; set; }Public Property DisplayName As String
Value
String String

InterComputeNodeCommunicationEnabled InterComputeNodeCommunicationEnabled

Edit

Gets or sets whether the pool permits direct communication between its compute nodes.

public bool ? InterComputeNodeCommunicationEnabled { get; set; }Public Property InterComputeNodeCommunicationEnabled As Boolean?
Value
Nullable<Boolean> Nullable(Of Boolean)

Remarks

Enabling inter-node communication limits the maximum size of the pool due to deployment restrictions on the nodes of the pool. This may result in the pool not reaching its desired size.

MaxTasksPerComputeNode MaxTasksPerComputeNode

Edit

Gets or sets the maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.

public int ? MaxTasksPerComputeNode { get; set; }Public Property MaxTasksPerComputeNode As Integer?
Value
Nullable<Int32> Nullable(Of Int32)

Remarks

The default value is 1. The maximum value of this setting depends on the size of the compute nodes in the pool (the VirtualMachineSize property).

Metadata Metadata

Edit

Gets or sets a list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.

public IList<MetadataItem> Metadata { get; set; }Public Property Metadata As IList(Of MetadataItem)
Value
IList<MetadataItem> IList(Of MetadataItem)

NetworkConfiguration NetworkConfiguration

Edit

Gets or sets the network configuration of the pool.

public NetworkConfiguration NetworkConfiguration { get; set; }Public Property NetworkConfiguration As NetworkConfiguration
Value
NetworkConfiguration NetworkConfiguration

ResizeTimeout ResizeTimeout

Edit

Gets or sets the timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool.

public TimeSpan? ResizeTimeout { get; set; }Public Property ResizeTimeout As TimeSpan?
Value
Nullable<TimeSpan> Nullable(Of TimeSpan)

Remarks

This timeout applies only to manual scaling; it has no effect when AutoScaleEnabled is set to true.

The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum value is 5 minutes.

StartTask StartTask

Edit

Gets or sets a task to run on each compute node as it joins the pool. The task runs when the node is added to the pool or when the node is restarted.

public StartTask StartTask { get; set; }Public Property StartTask As StartTask
Value
StartTask StartTask

TargetDedicated TargetDedicated

Edit

Gets or sets the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

public int ? TargetDedicated { get; set; }Public Property TargetDedicated As Integer?
Value
Nullable<Int32> Nullable(Of Int32)

Remarks

This setting cannot be specified if AutoScaleEnabled is set to true. It is required if AutoScaleEnabled is set to false.

TaskSchedulingPolicy TaskSchedulingPolicy

Edit

Gets or sets how tasks are distributed among compute nodes in the pool.

public TaskSchedulingPolicy TaskSchedulingPolicy { get; set; }Public Property TaskSchedulingPolicy As TaskSchedulingPolicy
Value
TaskSchedulingPolicy TaskSchedulingPolicy

UserAccounts UserAccounts

Edit

Gets or sets the list of user accounts to be created on each node in the pool.

public IList<UserAccount> UserAccounts { get; set; }Public Property UserAccounts As IList(Of UserAccount)
Value
IList<UserAccount> IList(Of UserAccount)

VirtualMachineConfiguration VirtualMachineConfiguration

Edit

Gets or sets the VirtualMachineConfiguration of the pool.

public VirtualMachineConfiguration VirtualMachineConfiguration { get; set; }Public Property VirtualMachineConfiguration As VirtualMachineConfiguration
Value
VirtualMachineConfiguration VirtualMachineConfiguration

Remarks

This property is mutually exclusive with CloudServiceConfiguration.

VirtualMachineSize VirtualMachineSize

Edit

Gets or sets the size of the virtual machines in the pool. All virtual machines in a pool are the same size.

public string VirtualMachineSize { get; set; }Public Property VirtualMachineSize As String
Value
String String

Remarks

For information about available sizes of virtual machines for Cloud Services pools (pools created with a CloudServiceConfiguration), see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/cloud-services-sizes-specs/. Batch supports all Cloud Services VM sizes except ExtraSmall.

For information about available VM sizes for pools using images from the Virtual Machines Marketplace (pools created with a VirtualMachineConfiguration) see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-linux-sizes/ or https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-windows-sizes/. Batch supports all Azure VM sizes except STANDARD_A0 and those with premium storage (for example STANDARD_GS, STANDARD_DS, and STANDARD_DSV2 series).
